author: VNExplorer
title: Married At First Sight expert Mel Schilling reveals she is heading home for Christmas after colon cancer surgery
text:
Mel Schilling is enjoying the greatest Christmas gift of all.
The Married At First Sight expert, 51, who recently underwent colon cancer removal surgery, took to Instagram on Saturday to announce she was heading home from hospital in London to spend Christmas Day with her family.
‘Driving home for Christmas,’ she captioned a heartwarming image of herself hugging her husband Gareth Brisbane, 51, and their daughter Madison, eight.
The trio were all smiles and dressed in Christmas sweaters.
Fans were thrilled with the news, with one commenting: ‘So good to see u ok and home for Xmas. Have a restful time being pampered by your family’.
Married At First Sight expert Mel Schilling, 51, who recently underwent colon cancer removal surgery, took to Instagram on Saturday to announce she was heading home from hospital in London to spend Christmas Day with her family. (Pictured with husband Gareth Brisbane , 51, and their daughter Madison, eight)
‘Christmas miracles do happen! So happy for you all!’ another added.
Mel’s happy news comes days after the psychologist and dating coach announced her tumour – which she named ‘Terry’ – had been removed by UK doctors.
‘So yesterday lunchtime I had keyhole surgery to remove my tumour (AKA Terry) and in the words of my amazing surgeon it couldn’t have gone any better!’ Mel wrote in an Instagram post on Friday.
She also shared this post to Instagram Stories, writing: ‘I get to go home tonight!!!’
She accompanied her post a photo of the TV star in a hospital bed, giving a thumbs up with a tube in her nose.
Mel added: ‘Crucially the cancer hadn’t spread to my abdominal cavity, which was our greatest fear but was entirely localised in my colon.’
Mel’s happy news comes days after the psychologist and dating coach announced her tumour – which she named ‘Terry’ – had been removed by UK doctors
‘Over the coming days I will discuss my treatment plan going forwards but suffice to say that Terry is toast!’
Mel then revealed her treatment had taken place in London and went on to praise the UK’s National Health Service (NHS).
‘I also wanted to say that everyone in the UK should be incredibly proud of the people of the NHS.’
‘So yesterday lunchtime I had keyhole surgery to remove my tumour (AKA Terry) and in the words of my amazing surgeon it couldn’t have gone any better!’ Mel (left, with fellow MAFS UK experts Paul Brunson and Charlene Douglas) wrote in an Instagram post on Friday
She added, ‘The NHS is a unique, precious institution we need to make sure it’s here to serve our children and our children’s children.’
Now, it’s time to focus on getting my ass out of here in time for Christmas,’ concluded the reality TV host.
Mel, who appears on the British and Australian versions of the show, first revealed she had colon cancer in an Instagram post early Wednesday morning.
In an Instagram post, Mel said she was diagnosed just one month after she began to feel pain in her stomach while filming MAFS Australia’s upcoming eleventh season.
Despite her heartbreaking situation, Mel said she felt ‘incredibly blessed’ her cancer is ‘relatively easy to eradicate’.
Mel, (right, with MAFS Australia experts Alessandra Rampolla and John Aiken) first revealed she had colon cancer in an Instagram post early Wednesday morning
Common symptoms of colon cancer include a change in bowel habits, rectal bleeding, anal or rectal pain, lumps, unexpected weight loss, fatigue and anaemia.
Doctors recommend that people with an average risk of the cancer start screening at around age 45.
Those with a higher risk should start screening earlier.
Colon cancer treatment usually involves surgical removal of the cancer.
Other treatments like radiation therapy and chemotherapy may be recommended, depending on the location and stage of the cancer.

author: Redacción Clarín
title: Paro de Aerolíneas Argentinas hoy, EN VIVO: hasta qué hora es, los vuelos afectados y todo sobre la medida de fuerza
text: En la previa de un nuevo paro de pilotos de Aerolíneas Argentinas que comienza este mediodía y se extenderá por 24 horas el Gobierno volvió a advertir que aplicará sanciones que van desde descuentos hasta el despido para quienes no cumplan con la nueva reglamentación dispuesta desde Casa Rosada que en las últimas horas declaró \"servicio esencial\" a la actividad aeronáutica. Tras la expulsión de tres pilotos el gremio del sindicalista K Pablo Biró cruzó al Gobierno: \"Desataron el caos es un juego que no tiene vuelta atrás\". Seguí todas las novedades en la cobertura minuto a minuto de Clarín.Qué vuelos se cancelaron en Ezeiza Mientras en Aeroparque Aerolíneas Argentinas canceló un total de 60 vuelos en el Aeropuerto de Ezeiza también se suspendieron o reprogramaron vuelos de la línea de bandera. En total son cinco los vuelos todos a destinos nacionales: Salta Mendoza Trelew Iguazú y Neuquén. Cada uno de ellos estaba listo para salir después del mediodía. Por su parte el vuelo a Madrid de 13:40 se adelantó para las 11 mientras que los vuelos nocturnos a Roma y Madrid aparecen como reprogramados aunque sin fecha aún. Video: El Gobierno advirtió que habrá \"descuentos y despidos\" El gremio de pilotos cruzó al Gobierno por echar a tres pilotos y alertó: \"El conflicto sólo tendrá un final cuando los salarios sean recompuestos a todos\" A través de un comunicado publicado horas antes del paro la Asociación de Pilotos de Líneas Aereas (APLA) repudió el despido de tres pilotos de Aerolíneas Argentinas al afirmar que la misma fue ilegal ya que los mismos estaban amparados en el marco de una protesta sindical legítima. Los pilotos se negaron a efectuar una operación de devolución de una aeronave EMB-190 como forma de \"reclamar un salario justo y acorde a las responsabilidades que se nos imponen\" dijeron. \"Es un hecho gravísimo que tiene la clara intención de provocar amenazar y amedrentar a quienes ejercemos nuestro derecho de protesta\" sostienen los pilotos. \"Han desatado el caos y están jugando irresponsablemente un juego que no tiene vuelta atrás. Exponen a trabajadores/as a máximos niveles de stress laboral de lo cual serán los directivos de la empresa y funcionarios del gobierno directamente responsables\" sostuvieron desde APLA y adelantaron que van \"a dar la lucha como siempre\" \"El conflicto se agrava y solo tendrá un final cuando los salarios sean recompuestos con todos/as los/las pilotos en sus puestos de trabajo\" cerraron el texto. Aerolíneas echó a tres pilotos que se negaron a devolver un avión alquilado por directiva de su gremio Aerolíneas Argentinas echó a tres de sus pilotos por haberse negado a volar a Estados Unidos un avión Embraer alquilado que debía ser devuelto a la empresa propietaria. Los nombres de los pilotos no trascendieron pero la información fue confirmada tanto en Aerolíneas como en la Asociación de Pilotos de Líneas Aéreas (APLA) el gremio que conduce Pablo Biró y que se apresta a encabezar el paro de 24 horas de este viernes. Leer más 60 vuelos cancelados en Aeroparque por el paro de Aerolíneas Argentinas En los carteles del Aeroparque Jorge Newbery comienzan a anunciarse las primeras cancelaciones de vuelos en la previa del paro que comenzará al mediodía. En concreto los 60 vuelos que tenía programados la empresa entre las 12 y las 00 del viernes aparecen como cancelados. El último vuelo programado de la empresa que saldrá este viernes será rumbo a Salta a las 11:50 El Gobierno advirtió que habrá \"descuentos y despidos\" para quienes no cumplan la reglamentación que declara como servicio esencial al transporte aéreo El Gobierno volvió a advertir que aplicará sanciones que van desde descuentos hasta el despido para quienes no cumplan con la nueva reglamentación dispuesta desde Casa Rosada que en las últimas horas declaró \"servicio esencial\" a la actividad aeronáutica. Así lo advirtió el secretario de Transporte Franco Mogetta. \"Quienes no se adecuen con sus tareas a partir de esta reglamentacion los que incumplan serán sancionados. La escala va desde descuento de haberes hasta despido\" sostuvo en diálogo con Eduardo Feinmann en Radio Mitre. Para el secretario el paro tiene que ver con \"las pocas horas de vuelo\" que tienen los pilotos. \"Lo que proponemos desde el inicio es discutir productividad. Algunos no llegan a volar ni 40 horas mensuales cuando otras aerolíneas están en 90 horas mensuales. Cuando ellos comparan sus sueldos con otras aerolineas tiene que ver con eso\" planteó. Además volvió a remarcar que avanzan con el pedido para excluir al sinidcalista Pablo Biró del directorio de la empresa. \"Vamos a avanzar con la exclusión de Biró del directorio de la compañía. Le vamos a reclamar al sindicato las pérdidas\" sostuvo. Según remarcó en otro pasaje de la nota las últimas asambleas generaron \"pérdidas por 2 millones de dólares\" Javier Milei firmó el decreto que reglamenta la esencialidad del transporte aerocomercial Horas antes del comienzo del paro Javier Milei firmó el decreto que reglamenta la esencialidad de la actividad aeronáutica civil aerocomercial pública y privada en todo el territorio nacional. La decisión había sido adelantada por el ministerio de Capital Humano el último sábado. El objetivo de la cartera a cargo de Sandra Pettovello es garantizar que haya un servicio mínimo para la población en días de medidas de fuerza. Leer más Paro de Aerolíneas Argentinas del viernes 13: qué vuelos están afectados y hasta cuándo durará Este viernes un nuevo paro de Aerolíneas Argentinas dejará a miles de pasajeros sin poder volar. Es el cálculo que ya hacen en la aerolínea de bandera: 37.000 afectados en 300 vuelos. Aquí una guía de qué tienen que hacer quienes debían volar entre este viernes y sábado. Este miércoles los gremios aeronáuticos resolvieron una medida de fuerza. La protesta la convocan la Asociación de Pilotos de Líneas Aéreas (APLA) y la Asociación Argentina de Aeronavegantes (AAA). Leer más

author: Shawn Johnson
title: Nigerian startup secures patent for blockchain technology
text:
Hyperspace Technologies Limited, a Lagos-based Web3 startup, has secured its second patent and trademark for CipherCHIP Tap2verify, a blockchain-integrated contactless product authentication and verification system.
Developed within the research and development (R&D) division of Hyperspace Technologies Ltd., the “CipherChip Tap2Verify” system is a new approach to product authentication by integrating Near Field Communication (NFC) tags, Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs), and blockchain technology. Presents perspective.
Recall that the startup secured a patent in August this year for CipherKey Tap2Sign™️ Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA), a next-generation security system that leverages the decentralized nature of blockchain, the strength of public/private key cryptography, and Designed for lifting. Features Near Field Communication (NFC) technology to provide an unprecedented level of protection against identity theft, phishing and social engineering attacks.
The trademark for CipherCHIP Tap2verify was granted on October 20, 2023 under the category of scientific, marine, surveying, electric, photographic, cinematographic optical, weighing, measuring, signaling, checking (observing), life-saving and teaching apparatus and instruments. , Apparatus for recording transmission or reproduction of sounds or images; magnetic data carrier recording disk; Automatic vending machines and mechanisms for coin-operated equipment; Cash registers, calculating machines, data processing equipment and computers; Free-extinguishing device.
Commenting on the journey of securing the patent and trademark, the principal inventor of MFA, Dr. Oluseyi Akindinde, highlighted its potential to revolutionize product origination and authentication.
“In an era where counterfeiting has become increasingly sophisticated, ensuring product authenticity is paramount. CipherCHIP Tap2verify addresses this challenge by combining the unique identification capabilities of NFC tags with the immutable nature of blockchain technology, which is further enhanced by the uniqueness of NFTs,” Akindeinde said.
Akindeinde said CipherCHIP provides an unprecedented solution to Tap2verify product authentication challenges. By seamlessly integrating NFC tags, NFTs and blockchain, it provides an unbroken chain of trust from manufacturers to consumers, he said.
Source: leadership.ng

author: Rocío Muñoz-Ledo
title: Machado critica al Tribunal Supremo de Venezuela por validar los resultados electorales; Maduro dice que la sentencia es “histórica y contundente”
text:
(CNN Español) -- La líder opositora venezolana María Corina Machado criticó este jueves al Tribunal Supremo de Justicia de Venezuela (TSJ) por validar los resultados de las elecciones del 28 de julio —de las que hasta ahora no se han publicado las actas desglosadas por mesa de votación—, mientras que el presidente Nicolás Maduro defendió la sentencia que ratifica su triunfo y la calificó de “histórica y contundente”.
En su cuenta de X, Machado respondió un mensaje del presidente de Uruguay, Luis Lacalle, quien más temprano dijo que el Gobierno de Maduro realiza un “fraude”.
“Presidente Lacalle, estamos profundamente agradecidos por su solidaridad y apoyo al pueblo venezolano. La acción del TSJ del régimen ratifica lo que todos sabemos: es un brazo de la represión, sin independencia y sin competencia en esta materia. Usurpa funciones del CNE (Consejo Nacional Electoral) con el fin de legitimar lo ‘ilegitimable’”, señaló Machado.
Sin dar detalles, el TSJ convalida anuncio de la victoria de Maduro en las presidenciales de Venezuela
“Se vuelven a equivocar. Se hunden y aíslan cada día más. Los venezolanos seguimos adelante con fuerza y convicción, y haremos respetar la soberanía popular. Sabemos que el mundo nos acompaña”, agregó la exdiputada, quien en octubre ganó las primarias de la oposición, pero no pudo registrarse como candidata porque está inhabilitada por cargos que ella rechaza y sostiene que la sanción es ilegal.
A lo largo de este jueves, al igual que Lacalle, el presidente de Chile, Gabriel Boric, y el de Guatemala, Bernardo Arévalo, criticaron el fallo del TSJ y se pronunciaron por luchar por la democracia en Venezuela.
La opositora Plataforma Unitaria Democrática (PUD) asegura que el verdadero ganador de los comicios fue Edmundo González, con base en actas que recabaron sus testigos en la mayoría de las mesas en todo el país.
Maduro: “¡Hágase la paz!”
El presidente Maduro celebró la decisión del TSJ, que —dijo— debe ser respetada.
“Basado en las leyes, como Poder Judicial de la nación, ha emitido una sentencia histórica y contundente, y nosotros decimos, desde las calles de La Guaira y de Venezuela: ¡Santa palabra, hágase la paz, respeto absoluto!”, señaló durante un acto público en el estado La Guaira.
¿Cuáles son las auditorías que el CNE no hizo tras las elecciones presidenciales en Venezuela?
Más temprano, el diputado oficialista Jorge Rodríguez, presidente de la Asamblea Nacional, también dijo que todos los actores políticos deben acatar el fallo del TSJ.
Por su parte, Simón Calzadilla, secretario general de Movimiento por Venezuela, uno de los partidos que integran la PUD, dijo que el bloque analizará la sentencia con sus abogados para definir sus siguientes pasos.
The-CNN-Wire
™ & © 2024 Cable News Network, Inc., a Warner Bros. Discovery Company. All rights reserved.

author: Mindy Sink
title: Here’s how to have a snowmobiling adventure in Colorado
text: Whether it’s your first time on a snowmobile or you’re ready to explore the wilderness on your own machine, there are plenty of opportunities to ride across the snow in Colorado. “Colorado has too many beautiful spots for snowmobiling,” said Ed Calhoun, president of the [Colorado Snowmobile Association](https://www.snowmobilecolo.com/), a nonprofit that supports safety and conservation for snowmobile activity. Snowmobiling has been steadily growing in popularity in Colorado. Colorado Parks and Wildlife issues snowmobile registrations and shows that 29,505 machines were licensed in 2022, up from 24,789 in 2020. The CSA is composed of 36 clubs. Its members groom about 3,000 miles of trails which also are used for Nordic skiing, dog sledding, snow biking and other winter fun. The CSA website has details on current conditions, where to take safety lessons, and the ins and outs of buying a permit. Here’s an introductory look at this winter activity in Colorado. Snowmobile tours with something extra Why not make the most of a snowmobile day and do more than just ride? [T-Lazy-Z Ranch in Aspen](https://www.tlazy7.com/) offers the Klondike Lunch Tour and the Majestic Lunch Tour. The Klondike tour follows a groomed trail in the White River National Forest to the Klondike cabin where a gourmet lunch awaits. (OK, the lunch features cheeseburgers, but they’re really good ones!) Kids as young as 4 can ride. Snowmobile drivers must be at least 18 years old and have a valid driver’s license. Although Independence Pass is closed to road traffic in winter, the Majestic Tour leads you to [the town of Independence near the Continental Divide](https://www.denverpost.com/2023/06/21/colorado-ghost-towns-abandoned-to-visit/). The Lost Man Cabin welcomes you with a lunch and spectacular views. This ride is best for those with some experience riding. Riders must be at least 7. You can combine a nice hot springs soak with your snowmobiling adventure at [Mount Princeton Hot Springs](https://mtprinceton.com/) near Salida. The concierge at Mount Princeton can arrange a guided snowmobile tour with a local operator. Upon your return, slide into the warm waters for a soothing soak. [Steamboat Snowmobile Tours](https://www.steamboatsnowmobile.com/) offers First Tracks tours on Rabbit Ears Pass, which can be a real treat on a powder day. It also offers four-hour Backcountry Adventure tours that take riders to the Continental Divide and include lunch. [White Mountain Snowmobile Tours](https://whitemountainsnowmobiletours.com/) in Leadville combines snowmobiling with ziplining. The day starts with ziplining, then it’s time for lunch in town. You’ll round out the day with an afternoon of snowmobiling. Keep in mind that Leadville is 10,158 feet above sea level and you’ll be riding higher than that during this day of adventure. Rent and go Many companies rent snowmobiles, so you can explore Colorado’s winter wonderland on your own even if you don’t own a snow machine. This also means you are in charge of your own safety, so keep these safety tips in mind: 1. Call ahead and ask what gear is included with your rental. Snowsuit or bib? Heated handlebars? Goggles? Gloves? If they’re not included, arrange to rent or buy them for your trip. 2. Take an avalanche safety course. Carry necessary gear, including a snow shovel, and know how to complete a rescue. Avalanche risk varies from day to day. It’s up to you to research current conditions. You should set out with an alternative plan in mind in case you venture into an area where the avalanche risk appears too great. 3. Bring water and sunscreen. 4. Have reliable communication, which probably means something other than a cellphone. Don’t put yourself, your trip mates and rescue teams at risk. Most rescue teams include many volunteers. They risk their own safety when they attempt to save people who are stuck or lost. “Some people want to go to the expert areas right off,” Calhoun said. “Normally that’s when you get in a problem with this stuff, and avalanches are the Number One danger for snowmobiling.” Popular spots for snowmobilers include Leadville, Grand Lake, [Vail Pass Winter Recreation Area](https://www.denverpost.com/2021/02/03/vail-pass-gets-a-few-upgrades-from-interactive-maps-to-avalanche-beacon-checkpoints/) and Rabbit Ears Pass near Steamboat Springs. Grand Lake is considered Colorado’s snowmobiling capital and features more than 300 miles of trails for every level of snowmobiler. There are another 700 miles of trails in surrounding Grand County. Snow machines are allowed in only a small area of Rocky Mountain National Park, but the region’s trails offer views of the park’s famous peaks and grandeur. It’s legal to ride a snowmobile in Grand Lake, provided the streets have enough packed snow. There are numerous outfitters to rent from in Grand Lake, and some lodges have snowmobiles available for rent. The Rabbit Ears Pass area offers trails across meadows and through snow-covered trees as you ride up and over the mountainous terrain. “I live in Steamboat,” Calhoun said. “People come here to ski, and they ski like crazy at high altitude, and then have to rest for a day or two. During that time, they can go snowmobiling with their families.” As with all winter sports, research conditions before you set out, wear appropriate gear, and always tell someone reliable where you are going and when you plan to return. [Subscribe to our weekly newsletter, The Adventurist, to get outdoors news sent straight to your inbox.](https://www.denverpost.com/newsletter-signup/the-adventurist)

author: Marta Moreno
title: Defensa premia a Lourdes Losa por el 8M: piloto en Afganistán y Senegal y a los mandos del avión de la Casa Real
text:
Con 40 años, la salmantina (aunque nacida en Zamora) Lourdes Losa tiene grandes hitos a sus espaldas. La comandante del Ejército del Aire fue la primera mujer en la historia de las Fuerzas Armadas españolas en ser número uno de su promoción, la LXI del Cuerpo General de la Escuela de Oficiales del Ejército del Aire. Este 8 de marzo, el Ministerio de Defensa, con Margarita Robles al frente, le concede el XI Premio ‘Soldado Idoia Rodríguez, Mujer de las Fuerzas Armadas’ por su profesionalidad y experiencia como piloto de aeronaves militares, además de por su destacada actuación en misiones internacionales.
Así se refleja en el Boletín Oficial del Estado de este viernes, Día Internacional de la Mujer, donde se materializa esta condecoración creada en el año 2007 con el nombre de la primera mujer militar española que murió en cumplimiento de una misión internacional de paz. El premio se concedió después de que un jurado, presidido por la Subsecretaria de Defensa, Adoración Mateos, así lo propusiese tras una reunión el pasado 5 de febrero. La condecoración se entrega a personas o instituciones civiles o militares que hayan contribuido a potenciar el papel de la mujer en las Fuerzas Armadas y a favorecer la igualdad de oportunidades.
Te puede interesar:
Aina Vidal: “España se ha convertido en la vanguardia de derechos feministas mientras Europa avanza hacia posiciones duras”
Piloto de Rajoy y de la Casa Real
Lourdes Losa comenzó especializándose con el avión militar CN-235, utilizado en misiones humanitarias. Después, estuvo destinada en Zaragoza pilotando un Hércules —la columna vertebral del mando de transporte militar—, para luego pasar a la base de Torrejón de Ardoz, donde se convirtió en la primera comandante de un Airbus 310 de transporte de autoridades, uno de los mejor dotados del Ejército del Aire. También pilotó el Falcon con el Gobierno de Mariano Rajoy.
Estuvo tres años en una base aérea del Ejército de Estados Unidos, en concreto, la de Charleston, lo que le permitió volar el Boeing C-17 Globemaster III, uno de los aviones más utilizados en misiones de distintos ejércitos, como el de EE. UU., Canadá, Reino Unido o Australia.
Te pude interesar:
Así se gestó la negociación de la amnistía: propuestas telemáticas, a tres bandas y con un acelerón final
Losa superaba las 3.200 horas de vuelo antes de ser comandante, un ascenso que le hizo volver a Salamanca y bajarse de los aviones, como suele pasar en estos casos con el Ejército del Aire. Tal y como comentó en una entrevista con un medio regional salmantino, durante su carrera ha vivido situaciones como que se le parasen los motores del avión o problemas con el sistema hidráulico. De hecho, estas situaciones le han permitido prescindir de la sensación de peligro en los vuelos comerciales. También ha vivido momentos difíciles y de tensión en sus misiones en Afganistán o Irak, con un riesgo muy elevado al estar en un escenario de conflicto.
Más Noticias

Cuánto se cobra de paro según los meses cotizados

author: NewsBreak Original
title: 2023 weather recap: It was one of the warmest years on record
text: The new year has started just like 2023 - mild! Most of Northern Michigan had above-average temps and dry conditions. The year began with limited snow and only bursts of cold air. The snow that did fall lasted only a few weeks and then melted just as fast. There was enough cold air to make enough ice to go fishing, but the ice fishing season didn’t last long. Snowfall was below average for most areas, leading to an extended fire danger season. There was a significant fire just south of Grayling that impacted travelers along I-75. The spring was dry and warm but not all the time. April 1st was an incredibly snowy day for Sault Ste. Marie. They received 18.6″ making it the snowiest April calendar day on record! The summer had its ups and downs with a burst of hot weather in late May and early June. More notable were waves of thick smoke from wildfires in western and eastern Canada from late Spring through at least mid-summer. Our summer heat didn’t want to end either with some of the warmest temps arriving on Labor Day. Gaylord and Alpena reached 94 degrees on September 4th and Traverse City hit 94 on the 5th. There was even more heat in early October. While everyone had the heat, Sault Ste. Marie was really toasty. They broke record highs 2 days in a row and the 83 made for an all-time record high for the Month! This fall and winter did feature some snow but what fell didn’t last long as skies remained fairly dry and temperatures were above average.

author: ajc.com
title: Scott Peterson prosecutor asks court to reject killer's appeal attempt | Fox News
text: Prosecutors have asked a California court to block new DNA testing of disputed evidence in the 2002 murder of pregnant Modesto woman Laci Peterson and her unborn son Conner - potentially setting up a road block at the heart of her husband and convicted killer Scott Peterson’s latest appeal. The Los Angeles Innocence Project picked up Peterson’s case in January. Lawyers have been arguing that a mattress found in a burned out car near where he lived with Lacey Peterson back in 2002 could show someone else was responsible for the murders of the 27-year-old and the couple’s unborn son Conner. SCOTT PETERSON DEFENSE DROPS MOTION TO SEAL IN BID FOR NEW TRIAL AFTER PROSECUTORS NOTE FILES MOSTLY PUBLIC The new appeal hinges on conducting state-of-the-art DNA testing on the mattress and a hammer with present-day technology. The Stanislaus County District Attorney's Office, which successfully prosecuted Peterson during his trial, filed a motion Monday arguing against new testing, noting that tests done in 2013 and 2019 went nowhere and calling out a series of lies exposed during Peterson's original trial, according to ABC 7, a local news station. SCOTT PETERSON CASE TAKEN UP BY LOS ANGELES INNOCENCE PROJECT, INVESTIGATING CLAIM OF ‘ACTUAL INNOCENCE’ A call to the district attorney's office went unanswered Thursday afternoon. However, the lengthy filing argues that there was already overwhelming evidence of Peterson's guilt revealed during his trial. Police arrested him in 2003 near the Mexico border after he bleached his hair blond and departed Northern California with his brother’s passport and $10,000 cash. TIMELINE: THE LACI PETERSON CASE A woman he was having an affair with named Amber Frey testified that he told her his wife was dead a month before she went missing. In recorded calls, he told her he didn't want to be a father and was considering a vasectomy. And his alibi, which was that he was fishing when his wife disappeared, placed him in the same body of water where her remains were later found. While Peterson has for years suggested the suspects in a burglary at the Medina household across the street from where he lived with his wife in 2002 could have killed her, prosecutors said that the break-in happened after she had already vanished. SCOTT PETERSON, KILLER OF PREGNANT WIFE, SPORTS NEW LOOK IN COURT IN LATEST BID FOR FREEDOM Lawyers for the Los Angeles Innocence Project are seeking new DNA testing on a hammer linked to a burglary across the street from the Peterson family home as well as a stained mattress found in a burned-out van parked less than a mile away. Peterson, who has always maintained his innocence, is currently serving a life prison sentence after a judge overturned his death sentence following a prior appeal. CLICK TO GET THE FOX NEWS APP His attempt to get a new trial was later denied. The judge previously scheduled a hearing on the DNA issue for May 29.
